A cloud is an aerosol containing a visible mass of minute liquid droplets, frozen crystals, or particles suspended in the atmosphere of a planetary body. The droplets and crystals may be made of water or various chemicals. On Earth, clouds are formed as a result of saturation of the air when it is cooled to its dew point, or when it gains sufficient moisture (usually in the form of water vapor) from an adjacent source to raise the dew point to the ambient temperature.
